Key Match Events: Pete Alonso hit a three-run homer in the first inning
The Mets held an eight-run cushion, which seemed like plenty
The Dodgers began rallying, and the Mets' manager had to burn his best relievers in extreme ways
Ryne Stanek and Edwin Díaz combined on the final 13 outs of the Mets' 12-6 win
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Carlos Mendoza told both Stanek and Díaz to be ready for multi-inning assignments
The Mets' bullpen was not necessarily in dire shape, but it was three-quarters of the way there
Mendoza sounded almost envious when discussing the Dodgers' ability to bring hard-throwing ace reliever Michael Kopech into the fifth inning of Game 3
Post-Match Reflections: Edwin Díaz said 'Today was the day, like, we’ve got to go forward'
Manager Carlos Mendoza said 'You’re doing the math, and you know that somebody’s going to have to come up big'
Outfielder Jesse Winker said 'These guys are nails, man. They’re ready to come in and get outs. They’re savages'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The series will go back to Los Angeles for Game 6
The Mets will be short-handed in Game 6 and will need starting pitcher Sean Manaea to go as deep as possible
Dodgers manager Dave Roberts spoke about remaining'steadfast in how you use your pitchers, because ultimately, it’s about winning four games in a seven-game series'
Others: The heavy workloads of Stanek and Díaz will affect them later in the series
The Mets' bullpen has been heavily used in the playoffs, and it's taking a toll on the relievers
